subject: Re: [junit] Is junit-dep supposed to work without Hamcrest?
msgSnippet: The answers are yes, junit-dep should work if you avoid any overt hamcrest mentions, and there appears to be a bug.  Can you make sure to file the bug at
messageBody:
The answers are yes, junit-dep should work if you avoid any overt
hamcrest mentions, and there appears to be a bug. Can you make sure
to file the bug at github? Thanks,

David Saff

On Sun, Oct 24, 2010 at 2:15 AM, pniederw <pniederw@...> wrote:
> Now that recent versions of junit-dep are finally available from Maven Central, I've tried to replace junit with junit-dep (4.8.2) in my project. The idea is to allow users of my project to use later versions of Hamcrest if they want to. However, after this change I get NoClassDefFoundError: org/hamcrest/SelfDescribing when calling org.junit.runner.Request.classes (see stacktrace below). Therefore my question is: Should junit-dep work without Hamcrest (as long as no Hamcrest-specific functionality is used)? And if yes, is there an unintentional dependency somewhere?
>
> Cheers,
> Peter
>
